shortdesc.ph: Retrieves the list of music resources for the specified music chart ID.
Retrieves the music resource list by music chart ID.

p.codeblock: virtual int getMusicCollectionByMusicChartId(agora::util::AString& requestId, int32_t musicChartId, int32_t page, int32_t pageSize, const char* jsonOption = nullptr) = 0;
public String getMusicCollectionByMusicChartId(int musicChartId, int page, int pageSize)

section.p: After calling this method, the SDK triggers the callback to report details of the music resources in the chart.
After successfully calling this method, the SDK triggers the callback and returns detailed information about the music resources in the chart.

plentry.pd: The request ID, used to uniquely identify the request.
The ID of the music chart. You can obtain this ID via the callback or by using the RESTful API to get the full or incremental music library list.
The current page number, starting from 1.
The number of music resources returned per page, with a maximum value of 50.

Extended JSON field, default is . You can use this field to filter the desired music resources. Currently supported filters:
pitchType: Whether scoring is supported.
1: Scorable music.
2: Non-scorable music.
needHighPart: Whether chorus segments are needed.
: Chorus segments required.
: Chorus segments not required.
Examples:
{ "pitchType": 1 }
{ "needHighPart": true }
The ID of the music chart. You can obtain it from the callback. You can also use the RESTful API to get the complete song list or incremental song list of the music library.
The current page number, starting from 1 by default.
The total number of pages in the current music resource list. The maximum value is 50.

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See the error code documentation for details and resolution suggestions.
On success, returns the unique identifier requestId for the request.
On failure, returns an empty string.
